posts.name: Rose Dray
posts.cooked:
Who in your opinion had the best of each individual subsystem entirely on their own, I’ve split the subsystems into

Manipulator (The thing that handles the coral/algae, feel free to shout out specific coral/algae only manipulators)

Arm/Elevator (The thing that gets the manipulator into position)

Climber

Intake (If thats intaking from the ground, then what gets the coral/algae INTO the robot, for example madtowns dual ground intakes, if its a station intake then thats the funnel/guide for the coral)

Drive Base (this could be due to speed, design, modularity, cleanliness, anything you think warrants pointing out)

Not meant to be a ranking or a competition just curious to see the best of the best subsystems.

posts.name: Matthew K
posts.cooked:
These are my opinions, I’m probably missing some teams (I get quite forgetful at 2am). Tried to also not have any repeats.

Manipulator: 254 Arm/Elevator: 1323 Climber: Early season 190, late season 2910 Intake: unclear, possibly 1690 for ground, 694 for funnel? Drivebase: unclear

Henbi3656:

Manipulator (The thing that handles the coral/algae, feel free to shout out specific coral/algae only manipulators)

first of all it was really cool but more importantly it was really really good at L1, mostly because it would release passively and not actively.

Henbi3656:

Arm/Elevator (The thing that gets the manipulator into position)

Probably 1323.

Henbi3656:

Climber

100% 2910 and it’s not even close.

Henbi3656:

Intake (If thats intaking from the ground, then what gets the coral/algae INTO the robot, for example madtowns dual ground intakes, if its a station intake then thats the funnel/guide for the coral)

Also 1690. I’ve described it in the past as treating the coral like it was made of foam and therefore flexible.bthe way the hard PVC pipe just flows through the intake is mesmerizing.

Henbi3656:

Drive Base (this could be due to speed, design, modularity, cleanliness, anything you think warrants pointing out)

not something we really get to see so can’t really say

posts.name: Hayden Show
posts.cooked: Looking at just climbers, I was a big fan of the dual purpose climber/ algae intake like 5460 and 4414 (pre rebuild) had. Im sure theres more, but those are all I can think of.

posts.name: David B
posts.cooked: The 118 everybot climber was goated this year so many teams used it. But 2910 also had an amazing one that I am excited to dive into the CAD/ details on.

posts.name: Ada T
posts.cooked:
Henbi3656:

Drive Base (this could be due to speed, design, modularity, cleanliness, anything you think warrants pointing out)

I’m going to go in a different direction than everyone else and say 2910, they always have by far the cleanest and best drivetrains imo

1323’s dual ground intake won them the championship. They pretty much only did L1 scoring during teleop in Einstein Finals, and since both alliances could fill their reef a good L1 bot was super necessary. Having the algae intake be able to consistently push coral into the double pyramids for 6 L1 per side was insanely valuable and meant that they didn’t have to take longer cycles to the back trough as often. They only lost when the L1 intake broke, or the L1 got unfortunately knocked over by 2910.

posts.name: Darren Cronstrom
posts.cooked: 1323’s wrist really impressed me, with how the managed to drive 3 motions in their wrist and manipulator without any of the motors driving them being on the wrist, instead packing them into the bottom of the elevator stage that holds the wrist.

posts.name: Stewart Riley
posts.cooked: Manipulator: 2910 - The over-under design and ability to take in coral in two orientations was very efficient and super fast for everything (both orientations of coral and algae.) It was also relatively small for all that it did and the wrist at it’s base ensured it could get the angle it needed for any placement. Arm/Elevator: 2910 again - That “patented” 2910 pinkarm was once again the most efficient and fastest arm on the field. Climber: 2910 - The simplicity of the dual-wheel gripper and the amazing speed with which it could be employed make this the best climber going. Plenty of times they were still scoring while their alliance-mates were already needing to set up for climb. Then they’d roll in at the last seconds and still get off the ground cleanly every time. Intake: 2910 - The fact that it was one piece with their manipulator kept it simple and yet it was highly efficient. The arrangement of the intake wheels and roller was especially nice.

posts.name: Matthew K
posts.cooked: Hmm, I think he likes 2910 everyone, but I can’t be too sure yet
